content:
Category: Music
Title: Somebody That I Used to Know
Section: Accolades

1. On 15 July 2011, the song finished third in the 2011 Vanda & Young Songwriting Competition, with the winning song, "Cameo Lover", by Kimbra.
2. Earlier that year, Gotye had first noticed Kimbra when both were short-listed as finalists for the competition.
3. At the ARIA Music Awards of 2011, "Somebody That I Used To Know" won Single of the Year, Best Pop Release, Best Video (for Natasha Pincus), Engineer of the Year (for François Tétaz) and Producer of the Year (for Gotye).
4. Gotye also won Best Male Artist for the song while Kimbra won Best Female Artist for her previous single, "Cameo Lover".
5. At the APRA Music Awards of 2012, "Somebody That I Used To Know" won Most Played Australian Work and Song of the Year and Gotye won Songwriter of the Year.
6. It is also nominated at the 2012 Teen Choice Awards for "Choice Rock Song" and "Choice Break-Up Song".
7. The song was nominated at the 55th Grammy Awards for Record of the Year and Best Pop Duo/Group Performance, winning both awards.

Category: Music
Title: Call Me Maybe
Section: Music video

1. A music video for "Call Me Maybe" was written and directed by Ben Knechtel.
2. According to Knechtel, the main idea behind the concept was to have a "twist at the end", trying to get away from the idea of the classic "boy meets a girl" story.
3. The music video has over 450 million views on Vevo and YouTube as of April 27, 2013.The video begins with Jepsen spying on her attractive tattooed neighbor, portrayed by Holden Nowell, as he is working on his lawn.
4. As he takes his shirt off and notices she is staring at him, Jepsen slips on her high heels and falls below her window.
5. She is reading the books "Love at First Sight (Men In Uniform)" by B.J.
6. Daniels and "Skylar's Outlaw" by Linda Warren.
7. The scene then cuts to her garage, where she is rehearsing the track with her band.
8. Following the rehearsals, her bandmates push her to go and wash her car, where she tries to gain her neighbor's attention with various provocative poses only to fall from the hood of the car.
9. She is briefly knocked out from the fall, during which she dreams of a romance novel-type encounter with her crush.
10. As she comes to, the neighbor then helps Jepsen to get up, and watches the band rehearse the track again.
11. After turning and writing down her telephone number, Jepsen sees her neighbor pass one of her male bandmates (Tavish Crowe) his own number, indicating he is attracted to the man instead.
12. The video received three nominations on the 2012 MuchMusic Video Awards in the categories of UR Fave Video, Pop Video of the Year, and Video of the Year.

Category: Music
Title: We Are Young
Section: Abstract

1. "We Are Young" is a song recorded by American band Fun featuring Janelle Monáe, for their second studio album "Some Nights" (2012).
2. It was released on September 20, 2011 as the lead single from "Some Nights".
3. Musically, "We Are Young" is an anthem that incorporates the genres of indie pop, alternative rock, and power pop.
4. The song received generally positive reviews from music critics, with many noting the song as a breakthrough for the indie genre and praising the song's catchiness.
5. "We Are Young" has attained commercial success worldwide, reaching number one in several countries.The track initially only gained attention from online media, although it did receive its first commercial radio airplay on Tampa Bay alternative radio station, 97X, debuting on September 19, 2011.
6. However, it was soon covered by the television show "Glee".
7. With the "Glee" version having success on the charts, the song was licensed for use in a Chevrolet Sonic commercial that aired during Super Bowl XLVI.
8. The single song propelled the band into mainstream success, topping the digital charts in February 2012 and becoming a crossover hit, peaking at number one on the "Billboard" Hot 100 through airplay on contemporary hit radio stations, topping the chart for six weeks straight.
9. It is also the first song to log seven weeks of 300,000 or more in digital sales, a record that was previously held by Eminem's "Love the Way You Lie" (2010).
10. "We Are Young" has been certified five-times platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America, and is both Fun and Monáe's first charting single on the Hot 100, as well as their first number-one single.
11. The song also topped the Hot 100 Airplay chart with 120 million impressions in seven weeks, becoming the first group since Destiny's Child's "Survivor" (2001) to do so.
12. The song was named 99th on the "Billboard" Hot 100 Songs of All-time.An accompanying music video was directed by Marc Klasfeld at David Sukonick Concert Hall in Los Angeles.
13. It features the group performing on a stage at a bar where a riot breaks out.
14. As part of promotion for the song, it was performed at the 2011 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival, the American late night television show "Conan", and was used as the opening song at the 2012 MTV Movie Awards.
15. The song is featured in the music video game, "Rock Band Blitz".
16. The song won the Grammy Award for Song of the Year at the 55th Grammy Awards, where it was also a nominee for Record of the Year and Best Pop Duo/Group Performance.

Category: Music
Title: We Are Young
Section: Composition and lyrical interpretation

1.
2. "We Are Young" is a power ballad that combines the genres of indie pop, alternative rock, and power pop.
3. The song is written in the key of F major, based almost entirely on the 50s progression (I vi IV V) with the exception of its bridge, and follows a tempo of 116 beats per minute, changing to 92 bpm from the pre chorus to the end.
4. The song has a slow hip hop groove from the first chorus onward, and the song in its entirety is in common time.
5. The instrumentation of the original mix session consists of drums, bass guitar, synth bass, electric guitars, synths, piano, horns and other brass, and a hugh amount of vocal tracks, as well as the rough mix and two reference tracks, by Queen and Kanye West, that are both muted in the final master.In the song, "careful arrangements layer sharp, bright piano melodies with big, booming drums and multiple vocal harmonies."
6. Ruess shifts from "vulnerable verbal tumbling in the song's sonically sparse intro to the grandiose declaration, 'Tonight, we are young / So let's set the world on fire / We can burn brighter than the sun' in the massive chorus."
7. According to "Spin", the song incorporates a "marrying fist-pump stadium rock to the prim indie-pop of Grizzly Bear's "Two Weeks," keeping the deliberate beats and soaring melodies but replacing choirboy primness with a percussive whomp."
8. Andrew Unterberger of "Popdust" compared the song's chorus to that of Pat Benatar's "Love Is a Battlefield" and Supergrass' "Alright," and noted that nearly every word in the chorus is imbued with maximum passion and importance.
9. Tim Jonze Guardian.co.uk described the chorus as anthemic and compared it to work done by Arcade Fire and stated that the lyrics were "life-affirming and fit for a teen movie soundtrack.
10. "Lead singer Nate Ruess says the lyrics were inspired by one specific night, after "my worst drinking night of all time."
11. Ruess told "Rolling Stone" that he was kicked out of a taxi cab for puking all over it.
12. "The cabbie was demanding all this money, and all I could do was stand on the corner with my head against the wall.
13. It took me another day before I was a functioning adult and could actually write down the verses," he said.

Category: Music
Title: Payphone (song)
Section: Synopsis

1. The video begins with a flashforward that starts with a beleaguered Levine torching his ride and dialing (possibly) his lost love's telephone number at a payphone.
2. Another typical day at a Las Vegas (seen from the decals on the police cars) bank for Levine is shown next, which turns into chaos when some bandits enter and take charge (one of them is played by the band's lead guitarist – James Valentine – and some of the other bank robbers are probably played by drummer Matt Flynn, bassist Mickey Madden and current keyboardist, originally a touring-only band member, PJ Morton) – all of this happens while the song plays in the background.
3. Levine grabs a gun from one of the robbers and threatens to get rid of them.
4. He and his female co-worker (played by Dutch model Bregje Heinen) escape though Levine is shot in the arm, but when some cops mistake him for one of the robbers, Levine tells the female co-worker to hide in a car and steals an AC Cobra 427 that belongs to Wiz Khalifa to get away from them.
5. A car chase follows and when Levine is almost caught by the police, he steers the stolen convertible onto the wrong side of the road and causes a huge explosion, which destroys one of the police cars.
6. When he finally reaches his destination in Los Angeles, he passes by a place where Wiz, the owner of the car, performed his rap earlier.
7. After Levine gets out of the convertible, it also explodes and he enters a booth, injured, with the titular payphone, probably to call for help (It is also likely that he is calling Heinen) – this connects to the beginning of the video.

Category: Music
Title: Payphone (song)
Section: Covers

1. On 7 May 2012, singing sisters Cimorelli posted a cover on YouTube, which has been watched over 15 million times but Dani and Lauren changed up the rap.
2. Tanner Patrick, Dave Days, Megan Nicole, Tiffany Alvord and Avery also posted cover versions of "Payphone".
3. In July 2012, Canadian indie group Walk off the Earth released a cover on YouTube where many of the instruments being played are looped live, allowing one member to effectively play six instruments over the course of the song, with the recorded loops all playing at once.
4. The same month, the band Boyce Avenue also released a cover of the song.
5. American post-hardcore group Crown The Empire has done a heavy cover of the song as well for Fearless Records' compilation album "Punk Goes Pop 5".
6. Comedy rapper Rucka Rucka Ali recorded a parody, "Dago", on his 2012 album "Rucka's World".In October 2012, Daniel Evans, a finalist on season 5 of The X Factor (UK) published and subsequently released an acoustic piano ballad version on his YouTube channel.

Category: Music
Title: Lights (musician)
Section: 2008–09: "Lights" and "The Listening"

1. Starting in early 2008, Lights toured cities in the Great Lakes region, in both Canada and the United States.
2. In late 2008, she toured the United States.In August 2008, Lights signed a record deal with Toronto based label Underground Operations.
3. She also signed an American partnership deal with Warner Bros. along with Doghouse Records.
4. Around the same time, her song "Drive My Soul" got to No.18 in the Canadian Hot 100.
5. After signing with them, her EP was released in stores on September 16.
6. Her second single, "February Air," sold 12,000 copies.
7. In early 2008, "February Air" was in a commercial for Old Navy.
8. It was later released in December 2008.In Ten Second Epic's song "Every Day" from their album Hometown, Lights contributed vocals and appeared in their music video.
9. The song appeared on the "Big Shiny Tunes 14" compilation album and the music video was nominated for Best Independent Music Video at the 2010 MuchMusic Video Awards.
10. She is also featured on the soundtrack (songs "Ben" and "Climbing") for the 2008 Canadian film "One Week", starring Joshua Jackson.
11. She was a guest vocalist on the album "A Shipwreck in the Sand", released in 2009 by post-hardcore band Silverstein from Burlington, Ontario.In 2009, Lights released her third single to Canadian radio stations called "Ice" with a homemade video released on her MySpace.
12. She also released a second video for "Ice" in Canada on November 10, 2009.
13. It was released in the United States on November 11, 2009.
14. On August 10, 2009, her music video for "Saviour" was released.
15. In an interview for the musical website Hall-Musique, Lights announced she was hoping to release her debut album in Europe by early 2010.In March, Lights was named on the American music website Shred News's 10 "Artists to Watch in 2010.
16. "While touring in the summer of 2009 on the 2009 Vans Warped Tour, Lights's single "Saviour" premiered on Canadian radio stations on July 6, 2009.
17. The song is from her first full-length album, "The Listening", which was released on September 22 in Canada.
18. It was released on October 6 in the United States after she left Underground Operations, for her own record label, Lights Music Inc.
19. The cover for the album was also released.
20. According to Lights, the entire artwork was inspired by "Watchmen", "28 Days Later", and "Sailor Moon".In September 2009, Lights toured with the British band Keane on their Canadian/Pacific Northwest tour.
21. In late 2009, Lights toured all around the United States and Canada with Stars of Track and Field.

Category: Music
Title: Lights (musician)
Section: 2010–present: "Acoustic" EP, "Siberia", "Siberia Acoustic", and "Tour"

1. She toured from January–May 2010 with contemporary synthpop artist Owl City in Canada, USA, and Europe.
2. Lights is featured on Owl City's song "The Yacht Club" on his album "All Things Bright and Beautiful" which was released on June 14, 2011, as well as appearing in the music video for another one of Owl City's songs "Deer in the Headlights."
3. Plans for future duets are in the works.
4. She was also in the summer 2010 Lilith Fair official lineup.
5. She went on a two week solo UK tour in May 2010 being supported by fellow Canadian artist Rich Aucoin for most of her shows.
6. Additionally, Lights was a special guest for pop-rock band Hedley's The Show Must Go... On The Road Tour, as well as These Kids Wear Crowns.Lights released an acoustic EP titled "Acoustic" in July 2010.
7. Her debut for the album was at the University of Waterloo, where she had received most of her inspiration for the album.
8. That same month, she began her six-date tour around the US, performing her songs acoustically.
9. In September, she toured with Hedley for eight dates on the Ontario leg of their Canadian tour.
10. In October 2010, Bring Me The Horizon's album "There Is a Hell, Believe Me I've Seen It.
11. There Is a Heaven, Let's Keep It a Secret" featured Lights as a guest vocalist on the songs "Crucify Me" and "Don't Go."
12. She is also featured on The Secret Handshake's song "Used to be Sweet" from their album "Night and Day".In October 2010, Lights released "My Boots."
13. She also left on her headlining tour with Jeremy Fisher.On June 18, 2011 at the Utopia Music Festival, Lights performed three new songs called "Toes," "Where the Fence is Low," and "Everybody Breaks a Glass.
14. "The single "Toes" was released on August 16, 2011 as the first single to Lights' second studio album, "Siberia".
15. After signing with Last Gang Records her album was delayed due to criticism from the label executives.
16. Though reluctant to tell full details of delays, the shift in style to a more gritty sound was a risk worried about by Last Gang Records.
17. The full-length album was released online in the US and Canada on October 4, 2011 and went on iTunes stores in Australia on October 28.
18. Siberia received positive reviews from many critics and was nominated for a Juno Award for Best Pop Album of the Year.
19. Lights says her favorite song on "Siberia" is "Flux and Flow.
20. "In July 2012, Lights's husband revealed that she was working on an acoustic version of "Siberia".
21. She seconded this by posting a photo on Twitter shortly after with a piano and acoustic guitars with the caption, "My station today.
22. Kind of intimidating..."On March 15, 2013, Lights released an acoustic version of "Cactus in the Valley" featuring Owl City as a single in the UK.
23. The album, "Siberia Acoustic", was released on April 30, 2013, and reached Number 7 in Canada.
24. She toured select dates around North America in support of the album, with Dear Rouge opening select dates and Lianne La Havas opening other select dates.

Category: Music
Title: Glad You Came
Section: Chart performance

1.
2. "Glad You Came" debuted at number one in Ireland, making it the band's first number-one single in the country.
3. The song was at number one for five weeks.
4. In the United Kingdom, the song debuted at number one with first-week sales of over 117,000 copies, becoming the band's second number-one single in the UK.
5. As of May 2012, it is their biggest-selling single to date with 540,126 copies sold in the UK.In Australia the song was certified Gold for shipping 35,000 copies.
6. In the United States, the song became their first to chart on the "Billboard" Hot 100, peaking at number three for four non-consecutive weeks after it was covered on the television series "Glee", and becoming the highest American chart entry by a British boy band, surpassing Take That who peaked at number seven with "Back for Good" in November 1995.
7. As of May 2013, the song has sold 3,600,000 copies in the United States.
8. The song was the best-selling song by a boy band in digital history before One Direction's "What Makes You Beautiful" overtook its sales in July 2012.

Category: Music
Title: Glad You Came
Section: In popular culture / Cover versions

1. •     The song was being used to welcome the Singapore Armed Forces Parachute Team (better known as the Red Lions) during the National Day Parade, 2012 in Singapore.
2. It was also covered on the TV show "Glee" by The Warblers, led by Grant Gustin, playing the character Sebastian Smythe.
3. It was covered on Kidz Bop 22.
4. •     The song was covered by the eleventh season top 10 on the 2012 summer tour as the finale song.
5. The song was also sung by the top 10 on twelfth season on the finale, May 16, 2013, where Candice Glover was crowned the "American Idol" winner.
6. •     "Glad You Came" was covered by Masha, on her YouTube channel on March 8, 2012.
7. •     American metalcore band We Came as Romans released a cover of this song for the compilation album Punk Goes Pop 5.
8. •     Megan Nicole has done a cover of the song on her YouTube channel.

Category: Music
Title: Stronger (What Doesn't Kill You)
Section: Usage in media

1. Cultural impact.Usage in media.
2. "Stronger" was also used in various forms of media.
3. It was used in a 2011 Toyota Camry advertisement which stars Clarkson singing the song with her co-stars Chris Berman, Andrew Zimmern, and James Lipton.
4. Amber Riley, Naya Rivera, and Heather Morris performed the song on the season three episode of "Glee" titled "On My Way", which aired on February 21, 2012.
5. Raymund Flandez of "The Wall Street Journal" described the trio's performance as "fine, fierce and fabulous."
6. Their version of "Stronger" debuted on the Hot 100 at number 66 on the week ending March 3, 2012 as "What Doesn't Kill You (Stronger)".
7. The song was featured in "Suburgatory" and was used in advertisements promoting the second season of the USA Network series "Fairly Legal".
8. It was also featured in a playable piece in the Harmonix video game "Rock Band Blitz", "Rock Band 3" and "Dance Central 3".
9. On May 6, 2012, a video of some of the patients and hospital staff of Seattle Children's hematology oncology unit dancing to the song were uploaded in YouTube to represent their fight against cancer.
10. The video became a viral hit and has been featured by "Time" and CBS News.
11. On February 26, 2012, Chemmy Alcott and Sean Rice skated to the song on Dancing on Ice.Maria Menounos and Derek Hough danced to the song in the fourteenth season of Dancing with the Stars.[117.
12. The instrumental version has been used as background music to the promotion and the opening theme to the 2013 MDA Show of Strength telethon.

Category: Music
Title: Stronger (What Doesn't Kill You)
Section: Cover versions

1.
2. "Stronger" has also been performed by contestants of various televised competition programs.
3. On February 21, 2012, It was covered on Glee by Amber Riley and Naya Rivera for the Regionals episode titled "On My Way".
4. On March 22, 2012, it was first performed by Diandra Flores on the sixth season of the Finnish television series "Idols".
5. On April 11, 2012, it was covered by Hollie Cavanagh, Joshua Ledet and Jessica Sanchez in the eleventh season of "American Idol".
6. On May 12, 2012, it was performed by Joelle Moses after will.i.am's recommendation on the first series of "The Voice UK".Clarkson also performed the song with Jordan Meredith on the television series "Duets", where she is also a mentor.
7. On March 16, 2012, the song was performed by various participants during the season finale of the fifth season of the Danish television series "X Factor".
8. On November 8, 2012, the song was performed by Team Adam and Team Blake on the third season of "The Voice".
9. On November 28, 2012, the girl-group Fifth Harmony performed the song on the second season of "The X Factor".
10. On October 28, 2013, Tessanne Chin covered the song on Season 5 of NBC's singing competition, "The Voice" for her performance in the Knockout round vs. Ashley DuBose (who performed "Hey, Soul Sister" by Train).

Category: Music
Title: We Found Love
Section: Recognition and awards

1. MTV chose "We Found Love" as the third best song of 2011, and "Video of the Year" at the MTV Video Music Awards 2012.
2. The writers of the website further commented, "The leadoff single from "Talk That Talk" is where Rihanna fully embraced EDM.
3. Produced by Calvin Harris, 'We Found Love' is a swirling party track about love and loss, the rare song that manages to be sad and joyous all at once.
4. And it is a pinnacle of the pop/dance crossover, a throwback to '90s raves that could make even the most stoic lover of pop want to break out a glow stick and just dance.
5. Rob Sheffield of "Rolling Stone" put "We Found Love" at number eleven on his list of Top 25 Songs of 2011 commenting, "While her other hits tried to camouflage her spindly voice, here it just strains for that spindly melody."
6. It was named the third biggest love song of all time by "Billboard".

Category: Music
Title: We Found Love
Section: Cover versions

1. British pop rock band McFly covered "We Found Love" on their "Keep Calm And Play Lounder" tour 2012.
2. Kele Okereke sang a verse of the song as the intro to his band Bloc Party's song "Flux" on their June 2012 U.K. tour.British alternative rock band Coldplay covered the song on October 27, 2011, during a performance at BBC Radio 1's Live Lounge.
3. Jocelyn Vena of MTV News called the performance "flawless", writing "Lead singer Chris Martin's haunting vocals and the band's acoustic rendition, using drums, piano and guitar, play up the sadness of the track."
4. Jason Lipshutz of "Billboard" magazine also noted that the band used "piano flourishes, a kick drum and a simple guitar lick to convey the song's romantic declaration", while making a ballad which was "reminiscent of Bruno Mars emotional reworking of Katy Perry's 'California Gurls.
5. Matthew Perpetua of "Rolling Stone" wrote: "It may surprise that their rendition is actually pretty good.
6. Whereas Rihanna's version is a thumping rave anthem, Chris Martin and company transform it into a lovely piano ballad nearly indistinguishable from many of their own songs."
7. A writer for "The Hollywood Reporter" said: "Martin's vocals blend with the piano for a slightly softer take on the tragic love story."
8. On February 17, 2012, British singer Jessie J made a cover of the song on BBC Radio1's Live Lounge.Lea Michele and Naya Rivera covered the song in the climax of the third season's tenth episode of "Glee", "Yes/No".
9. Romanian X Factor contestant Diana Hetea performed "We Found Love" in the "Public's Choice Gala" on December 10, 2011.
10. Even though ill of laryngitis, Hetea's performance was praised all three judges that called it " Perfect match for her!"
11. both visually and vocally.
12. Kris Allen also covered the song mashing it with other songs by Katy Perry and other female artists.
13. Carmen Smith also performed "We Found Love" for her battle round in the Australian Version of the Voice which saw her through to next round.In October 2012, British singer Ed Sheeran did an acoustic cover of the song for Sirius XM Radio.
14. Lindsey Stirling covered it in a music video filmed in a Kenyan village.

Category: Music
Title: Starships (song)
Section: Abstract

1. Starships (song)"Starships" is a song by Trinidadian-American singer-songwriter and rapper Nicki Minaj, taken from her second studio album "".
2. It was released on February 14, 2012 by Young Money, Cash Money, Universal Republic as the lead single from the album.
3. The song was written by Minaj, Nadir Khayat, Carl Falk, Rami Yacoub and Wayne Hector, and was produced by RedOne, Yacoub, and Falk.
4. "Starships" received generally favorable reviews from music critics, who complimented its production, though found it generic and criticized Minaj's transition towards pop music.
5. The song is Minaj's most successful single to date, peaking inside the top five in over fifteen countries.
6. It remains her most certified single to date, and has become one of the best-selling singles of all time.
7. The song also made US "Billboard" history, debuting in the US top ten and then spending a total of 21 consecutive weeks in the top ten.Minaj has performed the song live in a number of appearances, and was the encore performance on the .
8. The corresponding music video was shot Oahu Island, Hawaii.
9. Directed by Anthony Mandler, the song features Nicki on a beach in a bikini, and near the end of the video, it shows her and a "party-esque" dancing to the song and performing.
10. The music video was critically acclaimed from music critics, many praising the kaleidoscope effects in the video and the fun, carefree style.
11. However, some critics noticed its postponed release, because the video for her single "Beez in the Trap" was released before "Starships" was.
12. With all the success, the song has also sparked controversy surrounding a pulled live performance.
13. The song was included in the 2012 videogame "Dance Central 3" and is included in the best-selling videogame "Just Dance 2014".
14. It is also one of the select few songs available on "Just Dance 2014"'s demo version.
15. In September 2013 electronic artist Clive Tanaka filed suit against Nicki Minaj and the writers of the song, claiming it infringed on his own composition and recording, "Neu Chicago".

Category: Music
Title: Starships (song)
Section: Reception and contest

1. MTV's John Mitchell criticized the video's postponed release, finding it strange that the video for the album's third single, "Beez in the Trap", was released before that of "Starships".
2. On May 28, 2012, a "Starships" video campaign was announced on Minaj's official website.
3. It asked fans to record a video of themselves performing "Starships" by singing, dancing or with a musical instrument.
4. Minaj will then select 5 winners.
5. The contest winners won tickets and passes to meet Minaj on her Pink Friday Tour.
6. The song won the MTV Video Music Award for Best Female Video in September 2012.

Category: Music
Title: What Makes You Beautiful
Section: Background and release

1. After being formed and finishing third in the seventh series of "The X Factor" in 2010, One Direction were signed to Syco Music, a subsidiary of Sony Music Entertainment.
2. "What Makes You Beautiful" was written by Rami Yacoub, Carl Falk and Savan Kotecha, and was produced by Yacoub and Falk.
3. Instrumentation was completed by Falk and Yacoub.
4. Serban Ghenea handled the audio mixing, Tom Coyne the audio mastering, and John Hanes the mix engineering, for which Phil Seaford served as the assistant.
5. After recording the song at Cosmos Studios and Kinglet Studios in Stockholm, Sweden, the band felt relieved to have a song that they were happy to release as their debut single.
6. Band member Liam Payne called the song "perfect", and Harry Styles said, "When we were recording in the studio we knew instantly that we wanted this track to be our first single."
7. Styles spoke to MTV News, "I think for us we wanted to release something that wasn't cheesy but it was fun.
8. It kind of represented us, I think it took us a while to find it but I think we found the right song."
9. Payne added, "We always wanted single to be something that people didn't expect and then when we heard it, it wasn't what we expected either so it kind of fitted perfectly."
10. "What Makes You Beautiful" premiered on BBC Radio 1 on 10 August 2011, and was released by Syco Music in Europe, Australia and New Zealand via digital download on 11 September 2011.
11. A CD single was released in the United Kingdom on 12 September 2011, and followed in Australia and Germany on 25 November 2011 and 2 December 2011, respectively.For the North American release of "Up All Night" on 13 March 2012, Columbia Records executives used social media to shape its marketing campaign.
12. Columbia Records co-chairman Steve Barnett and his team decided to reverse the usual pattern of releasing a single on radio.
13. Instead the label mounted a four-month marketing campaign aimed at building a fan base through social media before a single was ever released or played on the radio.
14. The social media campaign asked fans to sign petitions and to enter video competitions to win a concert in their town.
15. The campaign was a success as One Direction's Facebook followers in the United States rose from 40,000 to 400,000.
16. As a result, "What Makes You Beautiful" sold more than 131,000 copies in its first week, even though it had yet to be played on the radio.
17. Radio programmers were flooded with calls from fans.
18. Johnny Wright, who managed New Kids on the Block, Backstreet Boys and 'N Sync, said: "Now they are calling the radio station, and the radio station is scratching its head, saying, "We don't even have that record yet".
19. It's almost like the return of The Beatles.
20. I call it hype, but it's positive hype because it's all real.
21. It's not manufactured.
22. No one paid these kids."
23. The single was released in Canada via digital download on 31 January 2012.
24. "What Makes You Beautiful" was released 14 February 2012 in the United States and was sent by Columbia Records to US contemporary hit radio (CHR) playlists on 28 February 2012.

Category: Music
Title: What Makes You Beautiful
Section: Live performances

1. One Direction performed "What Makes You Beautiful" for the first time on "Red or Black?"
2. on 10 September 2011.
3. The performance started with hosts Ant & Dec announcing that the band was supposedly running late for their appearance, and cut to a video of One Direction boarding a London Tube carriage full of fans, as the studio version of the song began playing.
4. Each fan on the tube was given a numbered ticket.
5. The band and fans disembarked the tube and made their way to the television studio, where the remainder of the song was sung live.
6. After the song, Styles caught a numbered ticket raining onstage.
7. The number corresponded to a ticket held by a fan from the tube; the colour of the fan's shirt was the correct answer for the "Red or Black?"
8. challenge.
9. The band performed "What Makes You Beautiful" after its B-side, "Na Na Na", at the BBC Radio 1 Teen Awards on 9 October 2011.
10. The band also performed the song to open telethon "Children in Need 2011" on 19 November 2011.
11. After "Gotta Be You" and "One Thing", One Direction performed "What Makes You Beautiful" at Capital FM's "Jingle Bell Ball" on 4 December 2011, at The O2 Arena.
12. They performed a medley of "She Makes Me Wanna" and "What Makes You Beautiful" with JLS on the "The X Factor" eighth series final on 10 December 2011.
13. The group performed "One Thing" and "What Makes You Beautiful" on "Dancing on Ice" on 5 February 2012.In Italy, the band performed the song at the 2012 Sanremo Music Festival on 14 February 2012.
14. In France, they performed "What Makes You Beautiful" and "One Thing" on "Le Grand Journal" on 22 February 2012.
15. In the United States, One Direction performed the song along with "More than This" and "One Thing" for the first time on "The Today Show" at the Rockefeller Center on 12 March 2012.
16. An estimated 15,000 fans descended on the plaza.
17. Melissa Lonner, senior entertainment producer for "The Today Show", said: "One Direction is relatively unknown with no hits yet.
18. They basically exploded, and all the adults are saying, 'Who are these people, and how do they know about it?'".
19. They also performed the song at the 2012 Kids' Choice Awards on 31 March 2012.
20. One Direction performed "What Makes You Beautiful" and "One Thing" on the NBC comedy television show "Saturday Night Live" on 7 April 2012, and also appeared in a comedy sketch with Sofía Vergara.
21. In Australia, they performed "One Thing" and "What Makes You Beautiful" at the 54th Logie Awards, where they also presented an award for "Most Popular New Female Talent" on 15 April 2012.
22. On 12 August 2012, One Direction performed "What Makes You Beautiful" at the 2012 Summer Olympics closing ceremony in London, which represented the handover to Rio de Janeiro as the host of the 2016 Summer Olympics.
23. It was included on the set list of the group's headlining sold-out show at Madison Square Garden on 3 December 2012.
24. One Direction performed the song on two of their major concert tours: Up All Night Tour (2011–12) and Take Me Home Tour (2013).

Category: Music
Title: Set Fire to the Rain
Section: Background and release

1.
2. "Set Fire to the Rain" was written by Adele and Fraser T Smith while the production was handled by Smith.
3. On 28 October, during an interview with "Billboard", Columbia Records revealed that "Rumour Has It" would be released as the third single from the album and serviced to pop and adult contemporary radio.
4. However, the release of the song was scrapped and "Set Fire to the Rain" was released as the third US-single on 21 November 2011.
5. A spokesperson for Columbia, Pete Cosenza stated: "Our research found more programmer preference for 'Set Fire to the Rain'.
6. [...] Both 'Rumour' and 'Fire' came back strong, but 'Fire' was a bit stronger.
7. [...] It's a better plan to go with 'Fire' over 'Rumour' at pop and adult radio.
8. [...] Everyone, from radio to the buying public, seems to be on board."

Category: Music
Title: Set Fire to the Rain
Section: Live performances and usage in media

1. Adele performed the song live for the first time on 29 April on "The Graham Norton Show".
2. She also performed the track on 3 May at Jools Holland along with the selections "Rolling in the Deep", "Don't You Remember" and "Take It All".
3. Adele also added the song to the set list of her second worldwide tour.
4. FX used "Set Fire to the Rain" to promote the final season of "Rescue Me" and the show's series finale.
5. The song was also featured in promotional ads for the TV series "Ringer" and "Revenge," which brought it airplay in the United States without her label having to release it to radio stations.
6. It was also used as an "insert theme" on the 2012 Fuji TV series "Iki mo dekinai natsu."

Category: Music
Title: Some Nights
Section: Recording and production

1. The most common creative process in the recording of "Some Nights" began with Ruess.
2. Ruess would come in with lyrics and a melody, leading Andrew Dost and guitarist Jack Antonoff to build chord structure and instrumentation from there, or "support that melody."
3. Dost noted that in recording, despite the composer's well-defined framework, the individuals' egos "pretty much disappear" and "everybody is happy to work towards the best possible song" cohesively together.
4. The dynamic between Bhasker and the band in the studio was mutually inspired, as Bhasker had never worked with a rock band before and Fun had never worked with a hip-hop producer.
5. Bhasker particularly enjoyed recording guitars with guitarist Jack Antonoff as he wasn't used to it, and Dost felt hearing Bhasker compose beats was "mind-blowing.
6. "The emphasis for Ruess on "Some Nights" was to make the songs more cohesive, as he felt his writing was "all over the place."
7. This meant creating songs that were concise instead of being "long and drawn out."
8. Bhasker was a proponent of using a single instrument to provide the biggest sounds, desiring not to "over-cram songs with ideas," declaring that everything that makes the song must be well-chosen.
9. Janelle Monáe collaborated with the trio on "We Are Young" through a friendship with Bhasker.
10. Bhasker was credited with bringing the band a bigger sound and an entirely new sonic translation to the band not present on their debut, "Aim and Ignite".The album creates a mix of indie pop, theatric rock, and hip-hop—a sound that is credited to Bhasker.
11. "Some Nights" as a title floated around before any songs for the album were even created and was envisioned by Ruess.
12. It was inspired by how personalities can change on any given night.
13. Although the album isn't a concept album, the title changed the band's ideas for the album considerably, with Dost stating, "It's really nice once you have a title to know what the parameters are of what you're working on as a whole."
14. The band completed production on the album in October 2011.
15. Ruess called the seven months spent recording the record the most rewarding of any in his ten years of professional music work, calling it his career highlight.

Category: Music
Title: Wide Awake (Katy Perry song)
Section: Release and reception

1. The video was supposed to have its world premiere on June 19, 2012.
2. However, the video was unexpectedly uploaded by EMI to the Czech website mixer.cz.
3. one day earlier.
4. Due to this, it was announced that the June 19 premiere was being scrapped and that the release was pushed up to June 18, 2012 at 7:53 p.m.
5. ET on MTV as part of ""MTV First: Katy Perry"".
6. After the premiere, an exclusive 30-minute interview with Perry will take place on MTV.com.
7. The worldwide premiere will reach more than 600 million households around the world via MTV’s global network of more than 60 channels, as well as over 300 digital media properties in more than 150 territories.
8. Fans around the world will also be able to stream the video online at http://katyperry.mtv.com.
9. The music video will also be shown on MTV’s sibling networks VH1, Logo and Teen Nick and debut on MTV.com, VH1.com and LOGOtv.com.
10. In addition, the video will go into rotation immediately on mtvU, MTV Hits and AMTV the following morning.
11. Perry stated in an interview that the music video is symbolic of her life, where various scenes in the video are redolent of her rise to stardom, personal struggles, love and marriage.
12. Perry received 3 nominations for this Video, which included Video of the Year in the 2012 MTV Video Music Awards.
13. She took home the "moon man" for Best Art Direction at the awards on September 6, 2012.The music video was met with acclaim from most critics, with a number of them deeming it the best video to date from Perry.
14. E!
15. Online opined in a Twitter status that they love the video and compared it to "Alice In Wonderland".
16. "Rolling Stone" gave the clip a positive review, praising its introspective nature, saying that 'Though the clip recalls familiar looks, the video puts a new spin on it all, recasting every colorful look with a melancholy tone and a darker palette.'
17. Hollywoodlife felt that the video is inspiring, while calling Perry a symbol of strength.
18. "Entertainment Weekly" also credited the fantastical, whimsical vibe of the visual as Perry teams up with her younger self.A "Behind the Scenes" video was released on August 22, 2012 on MTV and Vevo.

Category: Music
Title: Wide Awake (Katy Perry song)
Section: Commercial performance

1. Upon the release of "Teenage Dream: The Complete Confection", "Wide Awake" made its first appearance on the U.S. "Billboard" Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles chart at number 19 based on digital sales alone.
2. After Perry's performance on the 2012 Billboard Music Awards, it debuted on the "Billboard" Hot 100 at number 35 as the second highest debut of the week, behind Philip Philips' "Home".
3. The same week, the song debuted on multiple "Billboard" component charts - at number 29 on the Pop Songs and 35 on the Adult Pop Songs charts.
4. For the chart issue dated June 4, 2012, "Wide Awake" debuted at number 50 on the Dance/Club Play Songs chart as well as moving 5 spots on the Pop songs chart to number 20.
5. The song reached the summit on the week of August 4, 2012.
6. On June 13, 2012, the single moved ten positions to nine on the "Billboard" Hot 100, and has sold 402,000 downloads.
7. The following week, the single reached number 4, and on the chart dated August 11, 2012, it peaked at number 2 on the "Billboard" Hot 100, making the song Perry's eighth consecutive single to reach the top 3 of the chart since "California Gurls", as well as her first song to peak in the runner-up position.
8. It was kept off the top spot by Carly Rae Jepsen's "Call Me Maybe".
9. On the week August 4, 2012, the song topped the Hot Dance Club Songs chart, making her tenth consecutive number-one on the chart since 2009's "Waking Up in Vegas", extending her own record.
10. On the "Pop Songs" chart, it is her ninth number-one single tied with Rihanna as artists with most number one on chart.
11. The song has sold over 3,074,841 downloads in the US as of 2013.In Australia, the song debuted at number 26 on the Australian Singles Chart, and peaked at number 4, position it stayed in for three weeks.
12. In New Zealand, the song debuted at number 32, and peaked at number 1 on July 1, 2012, making it Perry's seventh single from the album "Teenage Dream" to peak inside the top ten, and her sixth song from the "Teenage Dream" era to take out the number one spot.
13. The song was then certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of New Zealand (RIANZ).
14. The song is the eighth song from "Teenage Dream" to enter the top ten, and the ninth consecutive top ten single since "Waking Up in Vegas" and its eleventh top ten overall.
15. The song makes Perry the female artist with the most number ones on New Zealand (eight), passing the previous record of Mariah Carey with seven number 1 singles.
16. In Canada, the song peaked at number 1, becoming her eighth single to do so.
17. The song became the 21st best selling single in New Zealand of 2012.
18. In the United Kingdom, the song debuted at number 69 on the UK Singles Chart, due to strong downloads in April 2012.
19. The song then re-entered at number 74 in May 2012.
20. It has currently peaked at number 9, selling 24,545 copies in that country.
21. In Ireland, the song launched at number 30 and is currently peaking at number 6.

Category: Music
Title: One More Night (Maroon 5 song)
Section: Composition and lyrics

1.
2. "One More Night" was written by Adam Levine, Shellback, Max Martin, and Savan Kotecha, while production was handled by Martin and Shellback.
3. It is a pop song, with a reggae beat infused into the percussion, giving the song a more dancey feel.
4. The song is in the key of F minor and in 4/4 time.Lyrically, the song is built upon the idea of the quintessential push and pull between what the heart, mind and body want, which are usually opposing things.
5. It starts with Adam Levine's "Ooh-ooh-ooh-ooh", underlined by a reggae beat.
6. "You and I go hard at each other like we're goin' to war", Levine sings and then tempers that statement by saying, "Try to tell you ‘no but my body keeps on telling you ‘yes’", lamenting over not being able to resist the atrractive charms of an addictive person.
7. The chorus finds Levine bewitched by someone he knows he shouldn’t be with: "So I cross my heart and I hope to die / That I’ll only stay with you one more night / And I know I said it a million times / But I’ll only stay with you one more night.
8. "Regarding the song's theme, Amy Sciaretto of "PopCrush" defined the track: "The song is erected on a thumped out beat, in addition to Levine’s signature falsetto, where he tosses off lyrics about not getting along with (or being able to untangle himself from) his lady love.
9. Levine is hoping he only stays with her just 'one more night'."

Category: Music
Title: Drive By (song)
Section: Abstract

1. Drive By (song)"Drive By" is a song by American roots rock band, Train, from their sixth studio album, "California 37".
2. It was released in the United States as the album's lead single on January 10, 2012.
3. The song was written by lead singer Patrick Monahan and Norwegian songwriting duo Espen Lind, Amund Bjørklund, the same team responsible for Train's 2009 hit single "Hey, Soul Sister".
4. "Drive By" peaked at number 10 on the "Billboard" Hot 100, becoming the band's third top 10 hit in the US.
5. It was awarded a double platinum certification by the RIAA on July 23, 2012, for more than 2 million sales in the US.
6. Internationally, the song became a top ten hit in 13 countries.
7. Train performed the song on television series "90210" in the episode "Blood Is Thicker Than Mud", which aired on March 13, 2012.
8. Train also performed a parody entitled "Five By" with Elmo and Count von Count for an episode of "Sesame Street".

Category: Music
Title: The Motto
Section: Abstract

1. "The Motto" is a song by Canadian recording artist Drake.
2. The song features Lil Wayne and is a digital iTunes Store bonus track from Drake's second studio album, "Take Care".
3. "The Motto" premiered on Los Angeles' Power 106 on October 31, 2011.Drake released the song on his OVO blog a day later.
4. It was first played on rhythmic top 40 radio stations on November 29, 2011, as the album's fourth single.
5. The track was a commercial success in the U.S., selling over 3,000,000 copies.
6. denoting 3× Platinum status.
7. The track peaked atop both the US Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs and US Rap Songs charts, and was ranked 20 on the Billboard Hot 100 Year-end Chart.
8. "The Motto" was nominated for Best Rap Song at the 55th Grammy Awards.
9. The song is one of the few songs to rank within the top 20 in the year-end chart, but to never crack the top ten, due to peaking at number 14.

Category: Music
Title: The Motto
Section: Cultural impact

1. The song uses the phrase YOLO, an acronym for "you only live once".
2. The phrase can be seen in youth culture, for example a high school prank in Chicago, Illinois, involved high school students chanting "YOLO."
3. Some people have graffitied YOLO on walls.
4. It has become a popular Twitter hashtag.
5. Some youth have said that it is their motto, and actor Zac Efron got a tattoo with the acronym.
6. Some youth, however, have taken action against the "YOLO" mindset; hip hop artist Joey Bada$$ released a song entitled "Death of YOLO" on his album "Summer Knights".
7. The song uses nearly dying in a car accident, a result of the "YOLO" lifestyle, as a metaphor for living making poor decisions.
8. The hip-hop magazine "Da South" reported that the rapper Lecrae has deconstructed the motto YOLO in his answer song "No Regrets".
9. The Washington Post describes YOLO as "the newest acronym you'll love to hate".
10. The Huffington Post says: "YOLO is dumb."
11. In his January 18, 2014 appearance on Saturday Night Live, Drake apologized for popularizing the acronym.The phrase "you only live once" is commonly attributed to Mae West, but variations of the phrase have been in use for over 100 years, including as far back as (the German equivalent of) "one lives but once in the world" by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe in the play Clavigo in 1774, and as the title of a waltz "Man lebt nur einmal!"
12. ("You Only Live Once!")
13. by Johann Strauss II in 1855.

Category: Music
Title: Everybody Talks
Section: Abstract

1. "Everybody Talks" is the lead single from American rock band Neon Trees' second studio album "Picture Show".
2. It was released on December 20, 2011 in the United States as a digital download on iTunes.
3. It soon became a sleeper hit.
4. The song made it to #6 on the "Billboard" Hot 100, making this song their highest charting single to date, as well as their first top 10 hit.
5. The song was mixed and engineered by Billy Bush and mastered by Joe LaPorta.
6. As of October 2012, the song has sold over 2 million digital downloads.
7. It also hit #7 on the Alternative Songs chart, their 1st Top 10 hit after Animal, it also hit #1 on the Adult Pop Songs, their 1st song to do so.
8. "Everybody Talks" was inspired by early 1960s pop music; Tyler Glenn said that "We fell in love with a lot of like Roy Orbison and the Motown music that my dad listens to."

Category: Music
Title: Everybody Talks
Section: Music video

1. An animated music video to accompany the release of "Everybody Talks" was first released onto YouTube on January 14, 2012 at a total length of three minutes and forty-two seconds.The real music video for "Everybody Talks" was released on VEVO and YouTube on March 8, 2012.
2. It features the band at a 1950s-esque drive-in watching a movie called "Zombie Bikers From Hell."
3. In the film, band members are playing music to the song inside a cabin when they're attacked by a group of zombies who are leather-clad motorcycle riders.
4. Tyler (the lead singer) is the only one to escape, while the other band members are slaughtered by the zombies, offscreen, to the horror of the audience members at the drive-in.
5. Meanwhile, in "real life" (the drive-in) a girl wearing red sunglasses starts seducing various male patrons.
6. Once she and the men are alone in a secluded area, she reveals herself to be a fire-breathing vampire and eats them.
7. In the film, Tyler hitches a ride from a girl in red-sunglasses.
8. As they drive off in awhite van, Tyler's fate remains unknown.
9. However, Tyler, and the girl are present at the drive-in.
10. The girl who drove up in the van at the end of the movie is the same girl who the band drove up to the cabin in.

Category: Music
Title: Take Care (album)
Section: Critical reception

1.
2. "Take Care" received generally positive reviews from music critics.
3. At Metacritic, which assigns a normalized rating out of 100 to reviews from mainstream critics, the album received an average score of 78, based on 34 reviews.
4. John McDonnell of "NME" dubbed it "an affecting masterpiece" and commended its "delicate, mellifluous sound and unashamedly candid, emotive lyrics."
5. Pitchfork Media's Ryan Dombal found Drake's "technical abilities" to be improved and stated, "Just as his thematic concerns have become richer, so has the music backing them up."
6. Andy Hutchins of "The Village Voice" called it "a carefully crafted bundle of contradictory sentiments from a conflicted rapper who explores his own neuroses in as compelling a manner as anyone not named Kanye West."
7. "Chicago Tribune" writer Greg Kot complimented the depth of Drake's "moral psychodramas" and stated, "the best of it affirms that Drake is shaping a pop persona with staying power.
8. "Nitsuh Abebe of "New York" wrote that the album "is full of gorgeous tones ... And the lyrics surrounding them can be rich with meaning".
9. Evan Rytlewski of "The A.V.
10. Club" found it "plenty downbeat, but gorgeous, an immersive headphone masterwork that's tender and intimate like little else in contemporary rap and R&B."
11. Ann Powers of NPR felt that "the artfulness of this music allows me an in to that experience.
12. I can make that leap and identify with Drake, or at least be intrigued by multiple characters in the little dramas he designs."
13. Jon Caramanica of "The New York Times" called it "an album of eccentric black pop that takes" hip hop and R&B "as starting points, asks what they can do but haven’t been doing, then attempts those things.
14. In the future an album like this will be commonplace; today, it’s radical."
15. With "Take Care", he named Drake "hip-hop's current center of gravity".In a mixed review, Kyle Anderson of "Entertainment Weekly" panned its content as "one overlong woozy monologue" and called the album a "total downer", adding that "Drake half-bakes his woozy rap-croon and glazes it with sluggish keyboard hums, ­stalling the album’s momentum".
16. Alex Macpherson of "The Guardian" found his singing "insipid", his rapping "inert", and his lyrics "hollow", writing that "he doesn't seem to realise that introspection is only worth a damn if you're an interesting person."
17. "The Globe and Mail"s Robert Everett-Green criticized Drake's lyrics as "drawling patter" and found the songs to "noodle around [...] aimlessly".

Category: Music
Title: Take Care (album)
Section: Accolades

1. According to Metacritic, "Take Care" was the ninth best ranked album in year-end top 10 lists by music critics, based on 135 lists.
2. It was named the best album of 2012 by the "Los Angeles Times" and "The New York Times", and was ranked number three by "Now" and MTV, number four by "Slate", number five by "Billboard" and "The Washington Post", number seven by "Fact", number eight by "The Globe and Mail", NPR, and Pitchfork Media, number 14 by Slant Magazine, and number 22 by "Rolling Stone" and "Spin".
3. It was also named as a longlisted nominee for the 2012 Polaris Music Prize on June 14, 2012.
4. In 2012, "Complex" named the album one of the classic albums of the last decade.
5. "Take Care" won a Grammy Award for Best Rap Album at the 55th Grammy Awards.
6. In October 2013, Complex named it the fourth best hip hop album of the last five years.

Category: Music
Title: I Won't Give Up
Section: Critical reception

1. The song received generally favorable reviews.
2. David Greenwald of MTV wrote, "The fresh track's wispy acoustic guitars and patient melody remind us of Irish crooner Damien Rice's 'Delicate,' though when Mraz soars into the chorus, it's with his own signature full-blast hook."
3. Loh Chuan Junn of MSN Music wrote that "The string-drenched, acoustic-guitar-based sound makes for easy listening, and gets into the listener's head after just the first listen.
4. With such an honest revelation of emotions in his lyrics, it's hard to imagine the tune does not stir hearts."
5. According to Katherine St Asaph of PopDust, the song was probably the closest to his and Colbie Caillat collaboration “Lucky.” She added that it was "a gentle acoustic ballad with a hint of speak-singing a ways in but otherwise straightforward and straight-faced soft-rocks its way through sentiments like “when I look into your eyes, it’s like watching the night sky or a beautiful sunrise–there’s just so much they hold”–still earnest, but joke-free."
6. Amy Dawson of Metro UK called it "a delicate, countrified guitar ballad that drives into a power-chorus singalong conclusion."
7. Colin McGuire of PopMatters was mixed in his review, writing that "'I Won’t Give Up', for instance, is acoustic guitar-laden folky pop that falls at least a little bit flat with its predictably bland approach.
8. While the song’s hook proves itself memorable enough, the track never graduates into anything other than the ballad-like tediousness the singer has a tendency to revert into."

Category: Music
Title: I Won't Give Up
Section: Chart performance

1. While the song debuted at number 8 on the "Billboard" Hot 100 chart, it immediately hit the top spot on the Hot Digital Songs chart selling 229,000 downloads for its first week.
2. On the Hot 100, the track's launch is the highest for a male pop/rock singer-songwriter since David Cook burst in at number 3 with "The Time of My Life" the week of June 7, 2008, after he was crowned "American Idol" champion.
3. On Adult Pop Songs it began at number 36.
4. On the week of October 18, 2012, the song became the "Greatest Gainer" on the Hot Adult Contemporary chart, reaching number 7.
5. After the success, his manager Bill Silva commented: "What surprised us is how the fans reacted.
6. We didn't pre-promote the single, we didn't go to radio with it, and this song did 229,000 units its first week in the U.S.
7. There was clearly something resonant about the song, and it immediately shifted the strategy for what the rollout of the album was going to be."
8. The song has sold 3,113,000 copies in the US.Internationally, the song also achieved success.
9. In Austria, the song debuted at number 23 on the Ö3 Austria Top 40 chart, on March 23, 2012.
10. Later, the song jumped to number 22, before falling for two consecutive weeks, until it reached again number 22, on April 20, 2012.
11. Later, the song reached number 20, before climbing to number 17.
12. On May 11, 2012, the song fell to number 21, but the next week the song peaked at number 12.
13. It spent 22 weeks on the chart.
14. In Netherlands, the song was a big hit, debuting at number 52 on the Dutch Top 40 chart, on January 7, 2012.
15. After climbing the charts for six consecutive weeks and reaching number 11, the song fell for two consecutive weeks, until it climbed to number 10.
16. The song kept on climbing for 2 weeks, until it peaked at number 3, on April 21, 2012.
17. It spent a total of 32 consecutive weeks on the chart.
18. In the UK, the song debuted at number 16 on the UK Singles Chart week of March 24, 2012, and peaked at number 11.
19. It remained for 30 weeks on the chart and became the 46th biggest selling single of 2012.

Category: Music
Title: It Will Rain
Section: Abstract

1. "It Will Rain" is a song by American artist Bruno Mars.
2. The song was released on iTunes for purchase on September 27, 2011.
3. An accompanying music video was planned to premiere on October 26, 2011 on MTV.
4. However, on October 24, 2011 Mars announced via Twitter that the music video had been delayed until a couple of weeks.
5. It eventually premiered on November 10, 2011.
6. The track appears on the soundtrack to the film ".In his live tour in Europe, Skylar Grey was with him singing the song.

Category: Music
Title: Party Rock Anthem
Section: Background

1. Music video.Background.The music video was released on March 8, 2011 and was produced by the two members of LMFAO, Redfoo and SkyBlu, with the assistance of Shinzu Ai.
2. It was choreographed by, and featured, Quest Crew members Hokuto Konishi, Victor Kim, Ryan Conferido, Steve Terada, Aris Paracuelles, Brian Hirano and Ryan Feng.
3. The video is a parody of the 2002 horror film "28 Days Later".
4. Lauren Bennett, featured in the song, also appeared in the music video.
5. Director Mickey Finnegan described the concept: "there's been an epidemic, the world has gone crazy, as soon as the song came out, everyone got possessed and all they want to do is to shuffle, everyone is a shuffler."
6. The video features the dancers performing the Melbourne Shuffle, which quickly gained popularity in the United States.

Category: Music
Title: Party Rock Anthem
Section: Television, films and video games

1. In popular culture.Television, films and video games.
2. "Party Rock Anthem" was used in several TV series such as in the first episode of "Awkward", in the season 3, episode 8 of "Glee", in the season 5, episode 12 of "Gossip Girl", in the season 3 finale of "Parenthood", episode 5 of 2 Broke Girls, in season 4, episode 14 of "Parks and Recreation", in the eighth season of "So You Think You Can Dance" and in the "South Park" episode "City Sushi".
3. It was also used in the opening titles for the Australian reality game show, "The Renovators".
4. There is a spoof of the song in the popular YouTube web series "The Annoying Orange" episode "Party Rock".
5. The song was also used in a Bat Mitzvah sketch in a "Saturday Night Live" episode hosted by Channing Tatum and in Australia's Got Talent 2011 sung by Timomatic.
6. Quest Crew danced to it on the season 6 finale of "America's Best Dance Crew".
7. On the episode 8 of "America's Best Dance Crews season 7, contestants 8Flavahz danced to the song.
8. The song was covered by Alvin and the Chipmunks and The Chipettes with lyric changes in the 2011 film ' and appears on its .
9. It was also featured in the trailer for the 2011 Lionsgate film "Madea's Big Happy Family".
10. It is also heard in the video games "Just Dance 3" and "FIFA Street".
11. The videogame "Dance Central 2" uses it on the DLC, which was released on February 28, 2012.
12. In "World of Warcraft", the dance emote for the male Pandaren is based on this song's choreography.

Category: Music
Title: Part of Me (Katy Perry song)
Section: Abstract

1. Part of Me (Katy Perry song)"Part of Me" is a song by American recording artist Katy Perry, released as the lead single from "", the March 2012 re-release of her August 2010 album, "Teenage Dream".
2. It was written by Perry and Bonnie McKee, with production and additional writing by Dr. Luke, Max Martin, and Cirkut.
3. The song was not included on the original edition of "Teenage Dream" because Perry felt that it did not fit the composition of the album.
4. A demo of the song leaked online in late 2010, amid speculation that the lyrics were directed to the singer's ex-boyfriend Travie McCoy.
5. "Part of Me" was re-worked and officially released on February 13, 2012, through Capitol Records with artwork by art director Gavin Taylor and photography by Mary Ellen Matthews.The production draws inspiration from several genres, including house music, dance-pop, and power pop; reviewers compared it to Jessie J's 2011 single "Domino", and Perry's 2010 singles "Firework" and "California Gurls".
6. Its lyrics describe a female protagonist who declares herself as un-breakable and strong following a break-up.
7. Contemporary music critics praised the song's production and gave it mixed-to-positive reviews, although some criticized Perry's vocals.
8. Many theorized that the lyrics addressed Perry's divorce from Russell Brand, although Perry stated it was not about him since it was written in early 2010.
9. "Part of Me" was a commercial success.
10. It was the twentieth song to debut at number one on the "Billboard" Hot 100, Perry's seventh number-one single on the chart, and her ninth consecutive number-one single on the "Billboard " Hot Dance Club Songs chart.
11. The single debuted at number one in the United Kingdom and Canada, and has been certified Platinum in the United States, Australia and New Zealand.
12. Marketing campaigns for Adidas and "" have featured it.An accompanying music video was filmed at the United States Marine Corps' Camp Pendleton in Oceanside, California.
13. The video depicts Perry enlisting in the Marines following a heartbreak.
14. It garnered generally positive reviews for Perry's "Girl Power" message, but drew criticism from feminist author Naomi Wolf, who denounced it as military propaganda.
15. Perry debuted the first televised performance of song on at the 54th Grammy Awards, and has also performed the song at the ECHO Awards, the 2012 Kids' Choice Awards, and "American Idol".

Category: Music
Title: Part of Me (Katy Perry song)
Section: Reception

1. The video garnered positive reviews from critics, who praised its self-empowerment theme and its different approach in comparison to Perry's previous music videos.
2. Bruno Nessif of E!
3. Online compared the video to Demi Moore's role in G.I.
4. Jane.
5. Ray Rahman from "Entertainment Weekly" echoed the similarity of the G.I.
6. Jane influence in the video, and called it an "intense ride".
7. MTV's James Montgomery praised the video and Perry's role, saying:"Over the years, Perry has been a California Gurl, a nerdy teenager, an alien and just about everything in between, but up until now, she's never really been an actual person."
8. He went on to praise the video stating: "Part of Me" is unlike any pop video in recent memory.
9. Rihanna did military chic in her "Hard" video (she even straddled a tank), and just about every one of Perry's pop contemporaries have ventured down the same path.
10. But they were never really in the military; they were just making it more fabulous.
11. Perry takes the opposite tact: She cuts off her hair, she eschews makeup, she fights, crawls, suffers.
12. It's a commendable level of commitment.
13. Your move, everybody else.
14. "Feminist author Naomi Wolf criticized the video as propaganda for the Marine Corps, stating "I really want to find out if she was paid by them for making it ... it is truly shameful.
15. I would suggest a boycott of this singer whom I really liked if you are as offended at this glorification of violence as I am."
16. Glenn Selig, founder of The Publicity Agency, responded to these claims on Fox News Live, stating, "In her efforts to boycott the video, Naomi Wolf has brought more attention to it, without her comments, most people would clearly have seen the military simply as a metaphor and not as an attempt by Katy Perry to glamorize the military or war."
17. Perry told MTV that she chose the military plot because it represented the song, saying, "It's an affirmation of strength, so I wanted to go the strongest route I ever could."

Category: Music
Title: We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together
Section: Europe and Oceania

1.
2. "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together" gave Swift's second top ten hit in the United Kingdom after it debuted at number five, and eventually ascended to number four.
3. As of January 2013, the single has sold 465,000 copies in the UK.
4. It charted in United Kingdom for twenty-nine weeks; ten weeks of it is within the top ten.
5. The single is certified Gold by the British Phonographic Industry for downloads exceeding 400,000 copies and ranked as the twenty-sixth best selling single of 2012.
6. In Ireland, the song jumped at number four on its second week after debuting at number eleven, became Swift's second top ten hit after her 2009 hit "Love Story."
7. "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together" also Swift's second top ten hit in Norway after it reached number seven in its third week.
8. It also appeared in Netherlands at number sixteen, in Spain at number nine.
9. "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together" became Swift's sixth top ten hit in Australia after it vaulted from number thirteen to number three in its second week.
10. It stayed at the top ten for seven weeks and charted for a total of twenty-four weeks.
11. The single is certified quintuple platinum by Australian Recording Industry Association for the shipment of over 350,000 copies, her highest certified song in the region.
12. In New Zealand, it debuted at number two, the highest debut of the week, and on its second week it rose to the number-one spot, making it Swift's first single to top the chart.
13. It stayed at the top ten for nine weeks, charted for a total of nineteen weeks and placed at number nineteen in New Zealand's 2012 year-end chart.

Category: Music
Title: We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together
Section: Synopsis

1. The video begins with Swift in colorful pajamas recounting the events of her off and on again relationship with her ex-boyfriend (played by Noah Mills).
2. The video then segues into Swift going into her living room where her band is dressed up in animal costumes and Swift belts out the chorus of the song.
3. The video then goes to a TV where Swift says "Like, ever."
4. and then to the dining room where we see she returns to recounting the events of her relationship and receives a phone call from her ex who is calling her from a nightclub.
5. Swift hangs up on him and he walks off screen into the nightclub.
6. It then goes to the two in a truck having an argument then to them having a stroll in the park.
7. Swift then runs off and we see her on the phone telling the person on the other line how she and her ex are not getting back together and her frustration of their entire relationship.
8. The video then segues back to Swift's living room where a party is going on and her ex shows up unannounced trying to woo her back and she slams the door in his face.
9. The video ends with Swift on her window ledge where she was at the beginning of the video, singing the last line of the song.

Category: Music
Title: As Long as You Love Me (Justin Bieber song)
Section: Synopsis

1. The video starts off with some flashbacks foreshadowing of what's going to be shown or happen in the video.
2. Then presently, at a mansion gate, Bieber appears as a loyal-but-troublemaking boyfriend to the daughter of an overprotective father, played by Madsen.
3. In what can be seen as a prelude to the main events of the video, Madsen finds the words "You r so sexy" written on his daughter's neck.
4. Outside their house, Madsen threatens Bieber to stay away from his daughter, despite Bieber's insistence that he loves her.
5. Bieber and his love interest secretly plan to meet at a train station late at night, to escape the clutches of her father.
6. However, their plans are foiled when Madsen finds his daughter's bedroom empty and races off, only to catch up with them in the middle of the street.
7. Bieber is assaulted by Madsen multiple times, only to rise to his feet and stand up again as the daughter watches and screams in horror.
8. As the video fades, representing that Bieber is passing out from the pain, Madsen drags his daughter to their car.
9. Throughout the video, scenes of Bieber and his love interest in various scenes (such as on her bed, at the park and on a rooftop) are shown, displaying their love.
10. The video also features a complicated dance routine performed in a parking garage, which is rumored by multiple critics to be a nod to the video for Michael Jackson's "Bad" (coincidentally, Madsen also appeared in the video for Jackson's "You Rock My World").
